[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Mobile Application System (MAS) defines requirements for GPS-enabled mobile applications, ensuring seamless internet connectivity, cross-platform portability, modular extensibility, and test environment availability.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MAS supports GPS-based tracking, real-time data exchange, cross-platform compatibility, and a modular architecture for future feature enhancements.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MAS integrates with GPS services, mobile internet, cloud storage, and authentication services.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MAS provides a responsive UI for iOS and Android platforms, ensuring uniform user experience.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MAS runs on smartphones and tablets equipped with GPS and internet connectivity.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MAS utilizes React Native for frontend, Node.js with Express for backend, and PostgreSQL for structured data storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MAS ensures real-time data synchronization via REST APIs and WebSockets.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: MAS is optimized for lightweight execution and efficient resource management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: MAS supports continuous GPS connectivity, real-time updates, and seamless background execution.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: MAS maintains compatibility with iOS and Android ecosystems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: MAS links to cloud storage, authentication APIs, and GPS tracking services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MAS facilitates GPS tracking, real-time communication, cross-platform support, and extensible architecture.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: MAS is designed for mobile users requiring GPS-based services with internet-dependent features.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: MAS requires stable network connectivity and GPS hardware support.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MAS relies on reliable internet access, GPS-enabled devices, and adherence to mobile OS standards.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Extensible Architecture: A modular design allowing feature scalability.
Test Environment: A controlled setup for validating application performance.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall maintain continuous internet connectivity for real-time data transmission.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with GPS hardware to enable precise location tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall ensure seamless compatibility with iOS and Android platforms (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support a modular architecture, allowing feature expansion without modifying core components (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall provide test environments for validating application behavior before deployment (REQ-INTF-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a consistent UI across all supported mobile platforms.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall maintain continuous GPS connectivity with a location refresh interval of 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store user preferences, GPS logs, and network activity history.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall ensure optimal execution efficiency on both iOS and Android platforms.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with mobile security standards and platform-specific policies.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall support OTA updates for seamless feature enhancements.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Connectivity, GPS tracking, and test environments shall be validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API references, and compliance guidelines.
[SEC] 5. References: Mobile OS standards, GPS best practices, and extensible architecture guidelines.
